description: Rinse the pumpkin and peel if desired. Remove seeds and cut the pumpkin into bite-size pieces. Peel the ginger and finely chop. Peel, halve and cut the onion into strips. title: Caesar Salad
description: If possible, prepare the dressing for the Cesar salad a few hours before serving the salad; this will allow it to soak through and develop its full aroma. To save some fat, the slices of toast can be toasted first and then cut into cubes.

description: Heat the oil in a pan and sauté the ham slices until crisp. Remove, allow to cool, and break into pieces. Mix ham into the salad and serve with grated Parmesan. Accompany the salad with toasted white bread.

title: Salad with Chicken, Cauliflower and Avocado
description: Rinse the chicken breasts, pat dry and season with salt and pepper. Then cook in a skillet in hot oil for 6-7 minutes until brown. Peel the garlic and grate on a wooden board with coarse sea salt. Cut the avocados in half, remove the pit, scoop the pulp solve with a spoon and coarsely chop. Immediately sprinkle with 2 tablespoons of lime juice. Mix the remaining lime juice with the vinegar, oil, herbs, garlic, a pinch of sugar, season with salt and pepper to make a vinaigrette. Cut the chicken breasts into strips or pieces and mix with the cauliflower, avocado, almonds and vinaigrette. Transfer to plates or small bowls and serve garnished with dill.

title: Potato and Lentil Salad with Pumpkin and Cauliflower
description: Rinse and peel pumpkin. Cut pumpkin pulp into 1.5cm (approximately 0.5 inch) cubes. Rinse, peel and cube potatoes. Rinse and dry cauliflower florets, cut if too big. Peel onions and garlic and chop finely, then mix with ginger. Heat butter in a large frying pan and sauté onion and ginger mixture. Add turmeric, coriander, cumin and remaining cayenne. Add potatoes and pumpkin, mix well. Add 1/4 liters (approximately 1 cup) of water and bring to a boil. Lower heat and simmer, covered, for 10 minutes. Add cauliflower and drained lentils and cook for approximately 8-10 minutes more. Add more water as needed.  Season with salt and pepper to taste. Garnish with mint leaves and serve lukewarm.

title: Coleslaw
description: Continue stirring until the mixture thickens, making sure that it doesn't boil. Rinse, trim, and julienne the cabbage. Peel and finely grate the carrot. Rinse, and coarsely grate the apples. Mix the cabbage, apples, and carrots together. Pour the sauce over the cabbage mixture, and toss thoroughly to combine. Season to taste, and let infuse for 2-3 hours before serving.

title: Cucumber and Sausage Sandwiches
description: Spread black bread slices with the mustard mixture. Top 4 slices of bread with capers, frisee lettuce, cucumber, dill and sausages. Cover with the remaining bread slices. Slice sandwiches in half and secure with wooden skewers.

title: Strawberry Salad with Cucumber, Hazelnuts and Feta
description: Peel the cucumber and cut into thin slices. Rinse the strawberries, trim and cut in half lengthwise or quarter. Toast the nuts in a dry pan, remove, allow to cool and coarsely chop. Cut the cheese into 0.6 cm (1/4 inch) slices and then into bite-sized pieces.

title: Chickpea Salad with Peppers
description: Prepare vinaigrette by combining vinegar with broth and oil. Season with salt, pepper and sugar. Combine chickpeas with peppers, lettuce and shallot. Toss with dressing and serve.

title: Potato Ravioli with Endive Filling
description: Rinse the potatoes and cook for about 1 hour in the preheated oven. Remove, cool slightly, peel and press through a ricer. While the potatoes are still warm, knead in the butter, cornstarch, and yolks. If the dough is too sticky, incorporate some flour and season with salt and nutmeg.

title: Savoy Cabbage and Smoked Pork Gratin
description: Spread in a greased casserole and cover well with aluminum foil. Bake in preheated oven at 180°C (approximately 350°F) for about 45 minutes. Sprinkle with parsley and serve.

title: Lamb's Lettuce Salad with Camembert and Walnuts
description: Rinse, trim and spin lamb's lettuce dry. Rinse apples, pat dry and cut into quarters. Remove cores and cut apples into slices. Sprinkle with reserved lemon juice. Cut Camembert into slices.

title: Marinated Zucchini
description: Toast the bread. Serve the zucchini salad in deep plates, garnish with mint leaves and serve with bread.

title: Sauteed Chicken Salad with Brussels Sprouts and Pine Nuts
description: Rinse the lettuce, spin dry and tear into bite-sized pieces.

title: Red Cabbage Salad with Orange Dressing
description: For the salad: Meanwhile, rinse cabbage, slice and break apart in a bowl. Add salt. Mince cranberries and add to cabbage. Roast almonds in a dry pan until golden brown and fragrant. Add to cabbage.

title: Lebanese Quinoa Tabbouleh Salad
description: Rinse and dry tomatoes. Cut tomatoes into quarters, cut out stems and dice. Rinse scallions, shake dry and cut into thin rings. Rinse parsley and shake dry. Pluck leaves and chop finely. Mix quinoa with tomatoes, scallions, parsley, lemon juice and oil. Season with salt and pepper.

title: Potato Ravioli with Endives
description: For the filling, drain the anchovies and chop. Peel the shallots and garlic and chop finely. Rinse the chile, cut in half lengthwise, remove seeds and ribs and chop finely. Rinse the endives, trim, shake dry and cut into thin strips. In a saucepan, melt 2 tablespoons butter and cook the shallots with the garlic, chile, and pine nuts. Add the endives and steam for about 2 minutes. Season with salt, pepper, and nutmeg. Remove from the heat and mix in parsley, anchovies, and Parmesan.

title: Cabbage Salad with Apples, Walnuts and Beets
description: Rinse, quarter, remove the core, and thinly slice the apples. Mix with 1 tablespoon of lemon juice. Slice the beets, and mix together with the apples, walnuts, and cabbage and serve.

title: Fried Fish with Tartar Sauce and Coleslaw
description: For the dressing: Combine all ingredients and season with salt and pepper to taste. Stir the dressing into the slaw.

title: Chicken Skewers with Lentil Salad
description: Soak the lentils overnight. The next day, drain them, place with the bay leaf, peppercorns and 1 pinch of salt in a saucepan, cover with water and cook about 45 minutes over medium heat.

title: Vegetable Salad with Yogurt Dressing
description: For the yogurt, mix the yogurt, cream, and about 40 ml (approximately 1 1/2 ounces) of water until smooth. Add the vinegar, and season to taste with salt, pepper, and sugar.

title: Mixed Greens Salad
description: Add the vinegar mix with the oil, salt and pepper, to taste and mix into the salad. Serve in small bowls arranged.

title: White Cabbage Salad with Olives and Feta
description: Peel the onions and finely dice.

title: Carrot Salad with Zucchini
description: Mix all of the vegetables for the salad together, and drizzle with the dressing. Mix until thoroughly combined. Garnish with the parsley.

title: Green Salad with Hardboiled Egg and Bacon
description: Rinse the tomatoes and cut into narrow wedges. Rinse the radishes, trim, cut into thin slices and halve. Brush the lettuce, rinse, spin dry and tear small.

title: Roasted Chicken Salad with Yogurt Dressing
description: Rinse the lettuce and spin dry.

title: Green Salad with Fruit
description: Rinse lettuce, spin dry, remove any inedible pieces and break into smaller pieces.

title: Perch on Carrot Salad with Yogurt-Dill Dressing
description: For the carrot salad: Peel and finely chop shallot, garlic and ginger. Peel carrots and thinly slice on the diagonal or slice with a mandolin or vegetable peeler. In a pan, sauté shallot, garlic and ginger in melted butter. Add carrots and sauté briefly. Sprinkle with powdered sugar and cook until slightly caramelized. Deglaze with broth. Add spices and season with salt and pepper. Simmer over medium heat about 10 minutes.

title: Raw Carrot Salad with Hard-boiled Eggs
description: Peel the carrots, cook a thick, big carrot in boiling salted water until tender. Cool in ice water, pat dry, cut into .6 cm (approximately 1/4 inch) slices and trim with a small, flower-shaped cookie cutter. Grate the remaining carrots. Stir together the grated carrots and the chopped egg.

title: Spinach, Duck and Melon Salad
description: Rinse and spin dry spinach. Tear, rinse and spin dry romaine lettuce leaves. Rinse oregano, shake dry and pluck off leaves.

title: Trout Tartare with Cucumber Salad
description: Place mixture into 4 ramekins lined with plastic wrap and refrigerate for 1 hour.

title: Arugula Salad with Edible Flowers
description: Mix together the arugula and the flowers, and divide into bowls. Mix together the olive oil and white wine vinegar. Season with salt and pepper, then drizzle over the salad.

title: Mustard Encrusted Rack of Lamb
description: Remove the membrane and french the tips of the bones until clean. Rinse the meat, pat dry, and rub with pepper. Rinse the herbs, dry, remove the leaves, and finely chop. Peel the garlic and finely chop. Mix the breadcrumbs with the parmesan, herbs, garlic, butter, and mustard.

title: Tuna with Green Salad
description: Halve the passion fruit, remove the pulp and mix with the orange juice.

title: Green Bean and Asparagus Salad with Almonds
description: Toast the almonds in a dry frying pan until fragrant. Remove from pan, cool and chop coarsely.

title: Lentil and Apple Salad
description: Rinse the lentils under cold water. Bring the vegetable broth to a boil, and cook the lentils for about 17 minutes.

title: Carrot and Poppy Seed Salad
description: Add honey and poppy seeds to saucepan and season with salt and pepper. Rinse herbs, shake dry, pluck off the leaves, mix with slightly cooled carrots and serve immediately in bowls.

title: Salad with Mushrooms and Chicken Breast
description: Rinse the chicken breasts, pat dry and season with salt and pepper.

title: Early Potatoes with Radishes and Asparagus
description: Peel the bottom third of the asparagus, cut off the woody ends and cook the stems in boiling water with a pinch of salt and sugar for about 15 minutes. Rinse with cold water, drain and cut into 3 cm (approximately 1-inch) long pieces. Rinse radishes, trim and cut into slices. Heat the oil in a pan and briefly fry the drained potatoes and the asparagus. Mix with radishes, parsley and lemon juice, arrange in a bowl and serve sprinkled with freshly grated Parmesan.

title: Salad of Spinach, Pears, Walnuts and Feta
description: For the dressing, mix the lemon juice with salt and pepper and drizzle in the oil. Spread the spinach on plates, top pears and sprinkle with crumbled feta, croutons and nuts. Serve drizzled with the dressing.

title: Lamb Salad with Feta and Beets
description: Coarsely crumble the feta. Rinse the beet greens, spin dry and trim the stems. Slice the beetroot into strips. Toss with the vinegar and oil and season with salt and pepper.

title: Russian-Style Coleslaw
description: Mix the vegetables with the dressing. Toss thoroughly to combine, and serve.

title: Scallop and Green Asparagus Salad with Lime and Cilantro
description: Rinse the scallops and the roe, pat dry, and dust with flour. Sauté in hot butter until golden brown on both sides. Add half the chile.

title: Monkfish with Avocado Salad

Cut the cucumber and avocado flesh into small cubes or 1/2 cm (approximately 1/2 inch) thick slices and place in the marinade, then let them marinate. Rinse the watercress, pat dry and pluck off the leaves. Rinse the monkfish in cold water and pat dry with kitchen towels. Remove the skin and bones, cut the fish into 2-3 cm (approximately 3/4-1 inch) pieces and season with vinegar, sea salt and pepper. Crush the spices coarsely in a mortar. Heat about 1/2 liter (approximately 2 cups) of water in a suitable pot for the steaming, add the spices and cook for 5 min. Place the fish pieces in the steaming pot and cover for about 6 minutes on medium heat. For the salad, fold the cherry tomatoes with the cucumber and avocado and season again to taste with salt and pepper.

Arrange lettuce with parsley on plates or in a bowl, top with pear slices and nuts and drizzle with the dressing. Serve.

title: Tuna Bean Salad with Egg

Heat the oil in a pan and saute the onions, garlic and zucchini about 2 minutes. Add the broth, simmer again for 2 minutes then remove from heat. Season the sauce with balsamic vinegar, salt, pepper and oil to taste. Rinse the lettuce, shake dry and tear into small pieces. Place lettuce in a large bowl. Arrange the zucchini-onion mixture over it. Add the capers, drain the beans and the tuna and arrange on the salad. Peel the eggs and cut into quarters and add to the salad. Serve to taste with freshly baked bread.

title: Cold Carrot and Orange Salad
description: Combine the carrots, nuts and ginger. Mix with salt, sugar, orange juice and zest. Mix in the oils.

title: Bean Salad with Tuna
description: Peel onion and chop finely. Heat 1 tablespoon of oil in a pan and saute onion until soft. Add drained beans and deglaze pan with vegetable broth. Simmer, covered, for about 45 minutes. or until al dente. Add more broth as necessary.

title: Chicken with Spinach and Bread Salad
description: Mix the oil with the paprika. Rinse the chicken inside and out, pat dry, season with salt and pepper and coat with the oil.

title: Vegetables in Filo Pastry
description: Cut the phyllo dough into squares about 15 x 15 cm (approximately 6 x 6  inches). Place two layers, slightly offset and overlapping, in the ramekins. Brush the layers of each with a little oil. Bake about 15 minutes until golden brown. Remove from the oven, carefully remove from the ramekins and allow to cool.

title: Arugula and Wild Herb Salad

title: Tomato Salad with Arugula
description: For the dressing, whisk the lemon juice with the vinegar and the oil Season with sugar and salt. To serve, sprinkle and drizzle over salad.

title: Grilled Steak with Tomato
description: Rinse the steaks, pat dry and season with salt and pepper. Brush the hot grill with the oil, place steak on it and grill for 3-8 minutes on each side (depending on thickness and desired doneness of meat). Rinse the tomatoes, remove the stalks and cut into slices. Season with salt and pepper, and grill along with the steak during the last 4-5 minutes of cooking.

title: Cauliflower Salad with Shrimp
description: Allow to cool and sprinkle with 2 tablespoons oil, vinegar, salt, pepper and sugar. Let soak approximately 20 minutes.

title: Chicken and Carrot Salad

title: Coconut-Crusted Fish Sticks with Cucumber Salad
description: For the fish sticks: Rinse the fish fillets, pat dry and cut into strips about 2x8 cm (approximately 3/4 x 3 1/4-inches). Season with salt and pepper and sprinkle with lemon juice. Whisk the eggs in a bowl. Place the flour and the coconut on two separate plates. Dredge the fish in the flour, shaking off excess. Then in the egg and finally in the coconut, pressing firmly to adhere. Heat the oil in a skillet and saute the fish, turning once until golden brown and cooked through, about 8 minutes. Serve with the cucumber salad.

title: Panzanella
description: Rinse arugula, trim and spin dry. Cut mozzarella into slices. Rinse tomatoes and cut in half.

title: Salmon with Lentils
description: For the dressing, mix vinegar with lemon juice, oil and sugar. Season with salt and pepper. Drain lentils and cool until lukewarm. Mix with dressing.

title: Herb Buns Stuffed with Pine Nuts, Olives and Sundried Tomatoes
description: For the filling: Toast the pine nuts until golden brown in a dry frying pan. Remove from the pan, let cool and chop. Chop the olives and tomatoes finely. Mix with the pine nuts and basil.

description: Meanwhile, rinse and halve the tomatoes. Cut the feta into cubes. Peel the onion, cut in half and then thinly slice. Fold the tomatoes, feta and onion into the lentils and then distribute among serving plates. Serve garnished with cilantro.

title: Grilled Cheese and Vegetables Sandwiches

After 2 - 3 minutes, when the cheese starts to melt, take everything out of the pan and place the cheese covered bread on a plate. Heat the mushrooms in the pan and spread on top of the cheese. Season with salt and pepper.

title: Pepper Salad
description: Mix the residual oil with the lemon juice, the zest and season with salt and pepper. Mix into the vegetables and let cool until lukewarm.

title: Stuffed Eggs

Blanch the tomatoes, rinse under cold water, peel, quarter, core and cut the flesh into small pieces. Rinse the cucumber, cut into quarters lengthwise and thinly slice.

title: Chicken Escalope with Rice, Cabbage and Pea Shoots

Cut the asparagus diagonally into 5 cm (approximately 2 inch) long pieces, mix with the lettuce and the tomatoes. Arrange on plates and serve drizzled with the dressing.

Transfer to a plated lined with paper towels and season with salt and pepper. Place the asparagus on a baking sheet lined with aluminum foil.

description: Rinse and pat dry fish fillets, drizzle with lemon juice and season with salt and pepper. Spread fish with vegetable filling and sprinkle with lemon zest. Roll up and secure with toothpicks. Arrange in a large steamer.

Cut the vegetables crosswise into thin slices and arrange on four dinner plates. Chop basil and parsley finely. Drizzle dressing over the vegetables and sprinkle with herbs. Cover the plate and let rest about 30 minutes.

title: Mixed Salad with Chicken

title: Vegetable Salad

title: Leaf Vegetable Salad

title: Grilled Ribs with Cornbread and Coleslaw
description: For the cornbread, mix the flours, baking powder, and salt in a bowl. Add the milk, eggs, butter and sugar and mix with a hand mixer to make a smooth batter. Pour into the baking dish and bake until golden brown about 45 minutes. If the bread starts to become too brown, cover with foil. Remove from the oven, cool slightly, then remove from the baking dish and leave to cool on a wire rack. Meanwhile for the ribs, cut into individual ribs, rinse and pat dry. Place in boiling water and simmer for about 20 minutes. Drain and pat dry. Peel the garlic and onion and chop coarsely. Rinse the chilies, cut in half, remove seeds and ribs and finely chop. Mix together with the onion, garlic, honey, salt, pepper, tomato paste, vinegar and Tabasco and bring to a boil with 200 ml (approximately 3/4 cup) of water. Reduce the heat and simmer for about 10 minutes. Remove from heat and let cool. Brush the ribs with a little oil and cook on the hot grill for about 20 minutes. Baste with the sauce during cooking. For the coleslaw, rinse the cabbage, trim and cut into strips. Rinse the carrots, yellow peppers, apple, scallions, and radishes, peel and trim as needed, slice finely and mix together. Mix in 200 grams (approximately 1 cup) mayonnaise. Mix the remaining mayonnaise with the cream. Season the coleslaw with salt and pepper. Place coleslaw in a small bowl and sprinkle with the mayonnaise mixture. Serve the ribs on plates with corn bread, alongside the coleslaw.

title: Fruity Spinach Salad
description: For dressing, combine vinegar, oil, mustard and sugar, then season with salt and pepper. Arrange the salad ingredients decoratively on plates, drizzle with a little salad dressing, garnish with chips and serve.

title: Asparagus Beet Salad
description: Cut the asparagus in half and mix with the beetroot wedges. Season with 5 tablespoons of olive oil, 3-4 tablespoons of vinegar, and season with salt and pepper. Let sit for approximately 20 minutes. Season to taste and serve.

title: Sautéed Scallops with Tomato Salad
description: Heat the oil in a skillet and saute the scallops 1-2 minutes per side until just cooked through, season with salt. Drizzle with the lemon juice and lemongrass. Serve with the tomato salad.

title: Vegetable Salad with Capers
description: Peel and chop the garlic. Mix the red wine vinegar with chopped garlic and olive oil to form the vinaigrette, and season with salt and pepper.

title: Fried Zucchini Flowers with Tomato and Feta Stuffing
description: For the batter: Whip the egg white with 2 tablespoons water until stiff and season with salt and pepper. Whisk the flour with the remaining water until smooth.

title: Mixed Salad with Ham and Eggs
description: Rinse the peppers, remove the stems, seeds and pith and dice.

title: Salad with Chicken Breast
description: Rinse tomatoes, trim, cut in half, remove seeds and cut into cubes.

title: Salad with Mixed Vegetables
description: Rinse and halve the peppers, remove seeds, remove white interior skins and cut into thin strips.

title: Cabbage Salad with Fruits
description: Rinse celery, trim and cut diagonally into 10 cm (approximately 4 inches) long pieces.

title: Mozzarella, Arugula and Tomato Salad
description: Whisk together 3 tablespoons of olive oil with the balsamic vinegar and season with salt and pepper.

title: Brussels Sprouts and Pear Salad with Prosciutto
description: Boil broth in a pot, add steamer to the pot, cover and cook over medium heat for 5 minutes.

title: Cabbage Salad with Apple and Grapes
description: Heat vegetable stock in a pot and mix with vinegar and oil. Season with pepper and pour mixture over cabbage. Mix well and marinate about 30 minutes. Drain cabbage in a sieve, then transfer to a bowl. Stir in yogurt and season generously with salt and pepper. Rinse, quarter and remove core from apple. Cut apple into thin slices. Rinse grapes and pat dry. Mix apple slices, grapes and sunflower seeds into the salad.

title: Potato and Asparagus Salad with Arugula and Prosciutto
description: Mix reserved cooking water with vinegar and season with salt and pepper. Whisk in oil and pour dressing over asparagus and potatoes. Let marinate about 20 minutes. Rinse arugula and shake dry. Cut prosciutto into strips. Toast pine nuts in a dry frying pan.

title: Broad Bean and Tomato Salad with Ham
description: Blanch the beans in salted water for about 4 minutes, then drain.

title: Mixed Salad with Turkey
description: Rinse chile pepper, halve, remove seeds and finely chop. Rinse cucumber and finely slice. Heat oil in a pan, fry turkey on all sides until browned. Arrange lettuce leaves on plates, sprinkle with peanuts and chile pepper. Peel ginger and finely grate. Mix lime juice in a bowl with oil and season with salt and pepper. Add ginger to the bowl, mix and drizzle over the lettuce. Cover salad with turkey strips. Serve garnished with cilantro.

title: Salad with Goat Cheese Crostini
description: Brush slices of white bread with some olive oil, place on a baking sheet and bake in a preheated oven at 220°C(approximately 425°F), remove the baking sheet and reduce temperature to 160°C (approximately 350°F).

title: Radicchio Tart
description: Preheat a convection oven to 180°C (approximately 350°F).

title: Orange and Brussels Sprouts Salad with Lentils
description: Rinse the sprouts, carve crosswise on the stalks and cook for about 10 minutes in boiling salted water until al dente. Drain and rinse cold.

title: Salade Niçoise
description: Mix lettuce, beans and tomatoes in a large bowl.

title: Endive and Vegetable Salad with Oranges
description: Peel oranges thoroughly and cut into fruit fillets. Collect resulting juice.

title: Green Salad with Poached Egg and Croutons
description: Mix 2 tablespoons of vinegar in a bowl with sugar, gradually add 4 tablespoons oil while stirring and season with salt.

title: Creamy Pasta Salad
description: Rinse lettuce, trim carefully and cut into strips.

title: Mixed Salad with Cheese
description: Rinse bell peppers, cut in half, remove seeds and ribs and cut into thin strips.

title: Shrimp and Mango Salad
description: Rinse the chile peppers. Slice the whole chile pepper multiple times with a knife but so that it is still connected at the stem. Place in cold water so that it opens up. Trim the half chile pepper, remove the seeds, rinse and chop very finely.

title: Salad with Vegetables and Chicken
description: Rinse tomatoes and cut into slices.

title: Herbed Cod with Avocado Salad
description: For the avocado salad: Combine mustard, vinegar and olive oil, mix well. Combine all salad ingredients and drizzle with dressing. Serve fish accompanied by salad.

title: Nicoise Salad
description: For the vinaigrette: Heat 2 tablespoons of olive oil in a pan and saute garlic and let cool. Mix remaining ingredients for vinaigrette with garlic, add oil and toss salad with dressing. Arrange salad on plates.
